intro: Pelargonium cochleatum, commonly known as the spiral geranium, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Pelargonium cochleatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique foliage.
